t: Amazon and the One-Stop-Shop: What Sellers Need to Know | Cahoot
s: March 3, 2025 - The One-Stop-Shop is a new VAT scheme that was introduced in July 2021 across the European Union. It offers an alternative for online entrepreneurs and Amazon sellers who, until then, had to register for VAT in a variety of countries if they wanted to expand their business across the EU.

t: One-Stop Shop: Definition, Example, History, Pros and Cons
s: As noted above, the term one-stop shop refers to a business that offers different goods and services—usually in one location. This can be under one roof in a physical store or through a single website like Amazon (AMZN).

t: One-Stop Shop: Jeff Bezos Wants You To Buy 'Everything' On Amazon : NPR
s: October 14, 2013 - In his new book, The Everything Store, journalist Brad Stone says Amazon "ended up forever changing the way we shop and read." He says CEO Jeff Bezos started out selling books, but always had the intention of turning the online market into a company that sold everything.
